_source.title: 20/85 The Experience
_source.review_text: I love this CD! This is my second one as my first wore out from the play! Definitely worth replacing! Very positive uplifting CD!

_source.title: ah
_source.review_text: I hope a lot of people hear this cd. We need more strong and positive vibes like this. Great vocals, fresh tunes, cross-cultural happiness. Her blues is from the gut. The pop sounds are catchy and mature.

_source.title: Ah
_source.review_text: I hope a lot of people hear this cd. We need more strong and positive vibes like this. Great vocals, fresh tunes, cross-cultural happiness. Her blues is from the gut. The pop sounds are catchy and mature.

_source.title: Marry Me Jane
_source.review_text: This album is strong from the begining. It's nearly a total new experience for those who hasn't listened the great voice of Kravat before. Since the sweet voice from Positive to the rage of Tabitha and the strenth in who is leaving who?.The lyrics are simple but interesting, using well-known ideas to explain feelings that we all had during the liftime.It's something you can't miss.

_source.title: Marry Me Jane
_source.review_text: This album is strong from the begining. It's nearly a total new experience for those who hasn't listened the great voice of Kravat before. _source.title: Girls Of Grace
_source.review_text: I was thrilled to find this CD. The music is fun, uplifting , has great lyrics and rythems. Very "pop" sounding - but with positive messages of faith and love. Originally had this as a tape years ago with my pre teen daughter - recently bought it again in CD form for her 16th birthday - it has been a wonderful renewal for us - once again singing along and sharing our faith. Great music for adults and kids alike !

_source.title: Somebody Somewhere Was Praying For Me
_source.review_text: Brenda is a wonderful person. Her aura is a positive one and she loves the lord and she helps others feel that love as well. She has a tremendous voice. I recommend that you get this cd.

_source.title: ...twenty-five...
_source.review_text: sweet honey in the rock does it again with an uplifting , thought-provoking, inspiring, beautiful collection of music. i found the use of percussion on "we are the ones" and "run" to complement the beautiful vocals very nicely. these two and others such as "sound bite from beijing" and "greed" are refreshingly thought-provoking in a positive way compared to much "popular" music i have listened to. their version of bob marley's "redemption song" is also very impressive
